Module schiffeversenken
Package de.uniluebeck.itm.schiffeversenken.engine

Class Application

java.lang.Object
de.uniluebeck.itm.schiffeversenken.engine.Application
public final class Application extends Object
Application this class contains the application boiler plate code to be run on a graphical OS.
Author:
leondietrich

  • Method Details

    • mainLoop

      public static void mainLoop()
      The main loop that handles the behavior of the application

    • setup

      public static void setup(GUIContext c)
      Use this method to set up the application
      Parameters:
      c - The GUIContext

    • isStillRunning

      public static boolean isStillRunning()
      Use this function to check if the game is still running. Please keep in Mind that a running application doesn't mean its healthy.
      Returns:
      True if it wasn't stopped yet.

    • stopApplication

      public static void stopApplication()
      Call this method in order to halt the game application.

    • switchToScene

      public static void switchToScene(Scene s)
      Use this method in order to display a different scene.
      Parameters:
      s - The new scene to show

    • log

      public static void log(String s)
      Use this method in order to log text to the screen.
      Parameters:
      s - The string to output.

    • crash

      public static void crash(Exception e)
      Crash application in case of fire. Use this method in order to mark a crashed game state.
      Parameters:
      e - The exception that caused the crash.

    • isFPSDisplayEnabled

      public static final boolean isFPSDisplayEnabled()
      Use this method in order to retrieve whether the frames per second are shown
      Returns:
      the true if the current frame rate is drawn on the screen or otherwise false.

    • setFPSDisplayEnabled

      public static final void setFPSDisplayEnabled(boolean showFPS)
      Use this method to enable or disable the current FPS counter within the upper right corner.
      Parameters:
      showFPS - true if the frame rate shall be rendered or otherwise false.

    • getCurrentResolution

      public static final Vec2 getCurrentResolution()
      Use this method in order to get the current contexts resolution. This may represent the actual rendering resolution and not the display or window resolution.
      Returns:
      The resolution of the context.

    • setMaximumFPS

      public static void setMaximumFPS(int maxFPS)
      Use this method in order to limit the current frame rate. This may be useful in scenarios where you don't need high refresh rates.
      Parameters:
      maxFPS - the new fps limit to set.

    • getCurrentMaximumFPS

      public static int getCurrentMaximumFPS()
      Use this method in order to get the current fps limit.
      Returns:
      the current fps limit.

    • loadTile

      public static Tile loadTile(String fileName)
      Ask the gui context to load a tile for us.
      Parameters:
      fileName - The file to load the tile from.
      Returns:
      The loaded tile.
